name: W Hong Kong

reviews.text: WO WO WO WO
reviews.title: FANTASTIC !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here during chinese new year 2013 ... amazing location , fantastic view , and connected with one of the best shopping mall in hong kong .
reviews.title: Impressed

reviews.text: the lobby is very unique , very nice staff .. and the room was WOW !!! and the best thing of this hotel for me is THE POOL !!! AMAZING !!!!
reviews.title: To Infinity (pool) and Beyond!

reviews.text: We dropped by HK after our 2012 Christmas/New Year holiday for 3 nights at W Hotel. It was chosen for the familiarity and convenience by my other half. Although I was doubtful as to how special this stay would be - it's only a hotel after all ... I really was happily surprised at what a great experience we had.
reviews.title: Scary to be off the island...but so much better!!!

reviews.text: Checking in and out was painless, the staff friendly although there was a bit of a wait both times. The room was comfortable: good bed, many pillows, block out curtains, no noise issues (big plus as I'm a fairly light sleeper), and had no issues with servicing.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a stunning spot. As usual with a W you have a great vibe and an exceptional style. Loved the rooms and thoroughly enjoyed staying here. It is the easiest place to get to from the airport, take the train right to the mall and head upstairs. Takes no time at all and has the check in counters there. The mall is great as well. I do prefer to stay on the island side though so for touring the hotel is quite removed. Our only issue was needing to taxi back to the hotel from the island so much. We prefer to eat/tour soho and the island so it was a constant trek back and forth. But for staying Kowloon side it is great - you just can;t walk anywhere local other than the mall. Would still go back though because we really appreciated the space.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If this hotel were a person, it would the guy at the club who never took his sunglasses off.
reviews.title: A bit too swanky but still loved it.
An Owesome W hotel
reviews.text: The music and the decor for the hotel were a bit too funky for my taste but I loved staying here nonetheless.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First location - it's a plus and a minus. The hotel is located in the Elements mall right off the Kowloon station line. To get to and from the airport, this is great. To get to Central - still great. But to get anywhere in Kowloon, it's a hike. You either need to walk through the long underground passages to the Austin station or about 20 minutes to Kowloon Park. The hotel operates a shuttle to the Sheraton. Otherwise, you have to cab it.
reviews.title: Good, But Tries Too Hard To Be Cool, Which Is, Like, Totally Uncool...

reviews.text: Rooms. I was slight annoyed by the bathroom walls. They slide open into the bedrooms which is a cool design but not my favorite. Otherwise, the room was comfortable and the views were good.
reviews.title: What a cool experience

reviews.text: W Hong Kong is one of my favorite hotel. I must admit that the hotel website pictures cannot impress me but once you are there and see the real hotel, it is totally different. My family falls in love with this hotel. The wow suite room is fabulous. You could feel like you are in New York at night time when you look out of the glass and see many high rise buildings 180 degree. The hotel location is very good, right next to the Kowloon station and the Element mall. The room is well designed to utilize the limited space. It is also cozy and clean. The services are excellent. Whatever you asked for, you would get within couple minutes.
reviews.title: Well what's a wow hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we enjoyed the swimming pool and the jacuzzi pool on the 76th floor. You can relax and spend the day there enjoy the expensive view of Kowloon. The jacuzzi pool in the changing room is also nice and you can have privacy while sitting there,relaxing and enjoy the lovely view of Kowloon. Do not miss the spa at Bliss, it is worth to try.
reviews.title: So Cool

reviews.text: The concierge was done the job exceeding my expectation. I never expect that they will provide a service to the Kowloon station but they did which could save our time to check in our luggage to the airport.
reviews.title: Very cool hotel with an extremely friendly staff!

reviews.text: We love this hotel and will come back again.
reviews.title: Chic, modern yet cool hotel - great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was modern, comfortable, very clean, quiet and safe. Beautiful variety of food. Free bus to the Centre of Kowloon. Big Shopping Mall and Metro Station under the hotel.
reviews.title: Wow, awesome hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon check in we were upgraded to a Fabulous room, and I have to say Fabulous indeed it was. Great view of the harbor that spent several hours just watching as the tugs worked, interesting to spend time watching an actual working harbor.
reviews.title: Great hip hotel with energy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a great location close to the markets and with the train MTR right next door in the attached mall.
reviews.title: Trendy-licious hotel for people who like to splurge in style

reviews.text: Excellent breakfast in the "Kitchen" and afternoon/evening cocktails in the "Living Room" were really enjoyable.
reviews.title: Nive hotel to stay for both biz and leisure

reviews.text: The vibe and atmosphere of the W is really great I thoroughly enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Streamlined elegance

reviews.text: My only question is the whatever/whenever... I did not see anything of this or see what the big deal was.
reviews.title: Comfortable and luxurious but with frills that were a bit ridiculous

reviews.text: The W Hotel at Hong Kong is an experience - a great one! From the curiously odd but cool design elevators, lobby and hallways, to the fabulously big rooms with dolby 5.1 sound systems, slide-out TV's, huge bath tubs, bathroom walls that slide and adjust to suit every situation, making the room even more spacious - this hotel is new, innovative and fab fab fab!
reviews.title: New & different, exciting & luxurious!

reviews.text: The spa at 72 - 74th floor is amazing. Swim or bubble at the jacuzzi at the height of 200+ meters, with a grand view to Hong Kong island and all the landscape around - and truly feel like you are on top of the world. The inside spa is also just awesome, with beautiful deco, lights, sauna, etc. One word: QUALITY.
reviews.title: WWWWWWWWWWOW W Hong Kong!

reviews.text: I would absolutely recommend this hotel to business travellers, adults on a fun holiday and people who want to enjoy a world-class spa with no extra fees attached to the use of the facilities (much unlike silly Intercontinental hotels etc, shame on you!).
reviews.title: A great place to stay!

reviews.text: I was traveling with a friend who was there on business and we had previously stayed in another hotel for four nights, as it was booked through someone else. We had planned to stay only three nights, but had to add another day. For the last day we decided to change to the W Hotel and it was one of the best decisions on the trip. We were upgraded to a harbor room, which felt like staying in a luxurious penthouse. All the staff were impeccably friendly, helpful and professional. I loved the gingerbread cookies in the lobby. As our last day was a leisure day, we decided to just chill at the pool. It had a great view, and again great service. It was such a welcome respite after staying in business hotels prior to this. A great perk of staying here was when we checked out, the bellman took all our luggage to the express train, making our next connection effortless. After staying here, I would be hard pressed to ever think about staying anywhere else in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: techno-chic extravagance

reviews.text: I stayed at the w Hotel Hong Kong for a Confrence, and it was excellant. The hotel is right next to a shopping centre where there is plenty of shopping to be done, alot of high end shops and places to eat. The train station is also next door and very easy to use (we got the train direct to Hong Kong Disneyland). The hotel also offers a shuttle service to about four destinations around kowlloon, you just have to get your own way back. The staff were so helpful, you could not fault them. I can recommend this hotel to tourists and for business.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - so easy to get comfortable

reviews.text: You cannot describe how wonderful this hotel is.
reviews.title: Best hotel I`ve ever stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our "fabolous room" was breath-taking: clean, beautiful interieur, comfortable and hipp.
reviews.title: Great location. Big room for HK. Trendy and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff there is extremly nice and attentive.
reviews.title: Excellent location, cutting edge style
truly unique
reviews.text: The check-in was super-fast and they`ve upgraded us from a normal "wonderful room" to a "fabolous room" (we don`t know, if it was on purpose or a mistake! But anyway-thanks!).

reviews.title: This is one "oh wow" hotel!
reviews.text: Beautiful bathrooms and design furniture like eames chairs in the whole hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel. Location was a little out of the way, but I loved the hotel, it was worth the taxis everywhere. The W is on an isolated side of kowloon, you cannot just walk out and be in a bustling city, instead there is a highway. However, the… hotel is very modern, sleek, simple and luxurious - you may never want to leave! The shuttle to TST was always fully booked when we needed it, so we never took advantage of that. HK island is only one stop away by metro, but to get to TST you need a cab (there is no direct line). The hotel is very convenient for the airport express and is connected to elements mall. There is plenty of places to eat in the mall and lots of high end shopping. The pool was incedible and open in january. There was no one there, and the water was very warm.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: I would stay here again if im on a budget and want a 5 star hotel. If not, i would consider staying at the 5stars on hk island side.
reviews.title: Perfect as Prefection can be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've staid at the W Hong Kong 10+ times over the last 2 years - and will stay in the future.
reviews.title: Pure Bliss!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Why?
reviews.title: Incredible Hotel, if you are staying in Hong Kong and want the best, stay here.

reviews.text: - because it's very stylish
reviews.title: Good hotel in Cowloon with no good view

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay at the W Hong Kong. It is very trendy like all Ws, but not intimidating/stuffy like some (see my W Hotel Hollywood review).
reviews.title: Lives up to the W brand - one of the best

reviews.text: All Ws have great rooms, but somehow the room here was that bit more refined. Somehow the bed seemed even more comfortable than usual? My those sheets are soft! The room I stayed in was small, but not as small as one I've stayed in in New York a while back, and because of the finish it didn't bother me at all.
reviews.title: Feel like a Rock Star!

reviews.text: It's one of those rooms that you look at and go "maybe when I do up my next house....."!
reviews.title: Good choice, but you have to know what you're getting into
Wow. Wow some more. Wow.
reviews.text: The view of the (commerical) harbour was surprisingly nice considering it's a bunch of big ships! I'm not sure if I was in an upgraded room due to being SPG gold, but it was on a high floor and very quiet.

Anyway, I only stayed here one night but am heading back before my flight home as we are travelling via Hong Kong again, and I'm really looking forward to it - that says something for someone who spends half their life in hotels (you miss home after a while, trust me!).
reviews.title: A very good hotel. We stayed in a...

reviews.text: If you like hip and young sounds and spaces, you'll love W Hong Kong. It's chic, with modern decor and a young and professional crowd. It was pricey for me, but I only stayed for two nights.
reviews.title: Youthful, Fun, but Inconvenient

reviews.text: PRIVATE SPACE: The room was beautiful; with sliding mirrors and doors with a generous and gorgeous view of the harbour from my room. I know some people did not like the fact that the washroom and the shower share one door (that slides). But I was alone and it was fine! I'm sure if you're a couple, you'll be comfortable with the one door covering. But if you're a family, it might be a bit strange. :) I liked the oversized bath; the rainforest style shower; and the BLISS products provided.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great room

reviews.text: PUBLIC SPACE: The sound which others have been complaining about, really isn't that bad. WOOBAR is amazing and not too loud. I could have a decent conversation without screaming. They said they had Japanese whiskey on the menu, but really didn't. And ultimately, the lobby might be a little loud because of the WOOBAR; but truthfully I'm not sure why people are complaining! The space is for travellers seeking some fun.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, fab views & great service!

reviews.text: CONS: The location and internet connection are my only complaints.
reviews.title: a great stopover in Hong Kong

reviews.text: W Hong Kong is situated above ELEMENTS (a high-end mall) which connects to Kowloon Station (TUNG CHUNG LINE) and Austin Station (EAST RAIL LINE). This makes check-in and check-out easy if you take the Airport Express ($90 HKD, $12CAD/USD). But, if you want cheap finds or eats, you have to trek a bit. The TUNG CHUNG LINE and EAST RAIL LINE aren't exactly the most popular lines. The HONG KONG ISLAND LINE's Central Station is about 20 minutes from where we are; but there's a 700m underground walk from the TUNG CHUNG to HONG KONG ISLAND line. I come to Hong Kong quite often, so this was the tail end of my trip and didn't mind the isolation. But I'd imagine for others, you'd want to choose somewhere else.
reviews.title: First class with everything except location

reviews.text: The W on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong lived up to the classic expectations of the brand. Stylish and Chic but low key, with staff that were efficient but under-stated; capable and very cool going about their jobs, in a friendly and helpful way.
reviews.title: Chic, Stylish & Efficient W Experience. Location slightly inconvenient
The W wows!
reviews.text: We lacked for nothing in our ‘Cool Corner Room’ which was large and well appointed, while the double aspect view of the developing West Kowloon waterside from huge windows was invigorating and made the room a light and airy space. Like all W’s it was fitted out with all the Tech stuff you needed, and some you don’t, while the Internet speeds were impressive.

We had a meal in Kitchen, which was good food and good value, all delivered by a server who understood exactly what we wanted and served us very efficiently. Later on the Woo Bar was stylish and fun, very comfortable and welcoming to all, with fast service and reasonable prices for cocktails. We could have stayed all night.
reviews.title: Chick, Modern, Different, Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only slight down-side of this hotel is the location. It is a long way on foot from Tsim Sha Tsui or other shopping and dining areas. There is a Hotel Shuttle, but with a limited route and quite an infrequent schedule. Therefore it’s a taxi-ride to anywhere from this hotel. I would suggest more Shuttles and more stops would be a good plan.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: Overall a very good stay and I would certainly go back. I usually enjoy W’s and have stayed in many; this is certainly one of the better ones I have experienced.
reviews.title: Modern and "chic"

reviews.text: On my last trip to HK a few years back, I stayed at the Peninsula so I knew going in what a premium HK experience should look like, and the W certainly delivers.
reviews.title: Lots of Luxury...Lots of Fun...Lots of Service

reviews.text: To keep the review brief, the standouts were:
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: Quiet...For a fun hotel in such a vibrant city, I was pleasantly surprised at the absolute calm and quiet in the room, even though the lounge and pool areas provided a buzz of activity and socializing.
reviews.title: Sensational!
Good but expensive
reviews.text: Luxury...The bedding and linens were of stand-out quality and made the perfect end to the evening and a perfect start to the day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Creativity...A W hallmark for sure, but very well executed here...especially in the bath, the lighting, and the hotel common areas.
reviews.title: Great hotel... but needs more atmosphere

reviews.text: Yes they made it! Location is perfect for eveything you want to do in Hong Kong!
reviews.title: 18 Days around the world
My "new favourite" hotel in Hong Kong
reviews.text: From the Airport you can reach the Hotel direct in 20 min with the MTR!
As well you can go where ever you want with the MTR around Hong Kong!
reviews.title: Far superior to even the very good W offering...

reviews.text: And you can check in at the railway station with your luggage !!!
reviews.title: Too cool for school trendy

reviews.text: The harbourview, the swimmingpool on the top roof 76 floor infinity wow!
reviews.title: Overrated

description: W Hong Kong is innovatively designed with 393 deluxe rooms and suites, cutting edge business facilities and function space, superior recreation facilities, award winning bliss spa and high-profile “W happenings”, all of which make it the traveler’s top choice. With the opening of Sing Yin Cantonese Dining, the reputation of W Hong Kong is further cemented with the surely avant-garde offering to the Chinese art of gastronomy in Hong Kong. Together with the launch of WOOBAR, the place to see and be seen, get ready for a nonstop entertainment spree in the vibrant and energetic setting of WOOBAR.
